<PAGE>

<P align=center><B><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>FIRST AMENDMENT <BR>A.G. EDWARDS, INC.<BR></FONT></FONT></B><B><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>RETIREMENT AND PROFIT SHARING PLAN <BR>2005 RESTATEMENT</FONT></FONT></B></P>

<P align=justify><FONT size=2><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The A.G. Edwards, Inc. Retirement and Profit Sharing Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) originally was adopted September 30, 1967. The Plan has been amended from time to time, most recently in the form of a restated plan document dated November 18, 2005 (the &#147;2005 Restatement&#148;).</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT size=2><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.G. Edwards, Inc., now wishes to amend the plan to provide distribution elections for Participants pursuant to the Katrina Emergency Tax Relief Act of 2005 and the Gulf Opportunity Zone Act of 2005.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby amended as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT size=2><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;Effective November 18, 2005, a new Section, 12.4, is added to the Plan to read in its entirety as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;12.4 <B><I>KETRA Withdrawal Option.</I></B> A Participant who is an Employee may, upon notice received by the Plan Administrator or its delegate, withdraw aggregate distributions up to $100,000 from August 25, 2005 until December 31, 2006 of employee contributions and vested firm contributions pursuant to the Katrina Emergency Tax Relief Act of 2005 that allows distributions to an individual who has sustained an economic loss from Hurricane Katrina and whose principal place of abode on August 28, 2005 was in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT size=2><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;Effective November 18, 2005, a new Section, 13.2, is added to the Plan to read in its entirety as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;13.2 <B><I>KETRA Withdrawal Option.</I></B> In the event a Participant shall incur a Termination of Employment under circumstances such that the Participant is not entitled to receive payment of his benefits under the Plan immediately upon such Termination of Employment, such Participant may, upon notice in a manner suitable to the Plan Administrator, withdraw aggregate distributions up to $100,000 from August 25, 2005 until December 31, 2006 of employee contributions and vested firm contributions pursuant to the Katrina Emergency Tax Relief Act of 2005 that allows distributions to an individual who has sustained an economic loss from Hurricane Katrina and whose principal place of abode on August 25, 2005 was in the Hurricane Katrina disaster area.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT size=2><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3. Effective February 23, 2006, a new Section, 12.5, is added to the Plan to read in its entirety as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>- 57 -</FONT></FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>12.5<FONT face=sans-serif></FONT> <B><I>Gulf Opportunity Zone Act Withdrawal Option.</I></B> A Participant who is an Employee may, upon notice received by the Plan Administrator or its delegate, withdraw aggregate distributions up to $100,000 from September 23, 2005 until December 31, 2006 of employee contributions and vested firm contributions pursuant to the Gulf Opportunity Zone Act of 2005 that allows distributions to an individual who has sustained an economic loss from Hurricane Rita and whose principal place of abode on September 23, 2005 was in the Hurricane Rita disaster area.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>A Participant who is an Employee may, upon notice received by the Plan Administrator or its delegate, withdraw aggregate distributions up to $100,000 from October 23, 2005 until December 31, 2006 of employee contributions and vested firm contributions pursuant to the Gulf Opportunity Zone Act of 2005 that allows distributions to an individual who has sustained an economic loss from Hurricane Wilma and whose principal place of abode on October 23, 2005 was in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>4.&nbsp;</FONT><FONT face=serif>Effective November 18, 2005, a new Section, 13.3, is added to the Plan to read in its entirety as follows:</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>13.3</FONT> <B><I><FONT face=serif>Gulf Opportunity Zone Withdrawal Option.</FONT></I></B> <FONT face=serif>In the event a Participant shall incur a Termination of Employment under circumstances such that the Participant is not entitled to receive payment of his benefits under the Plan immediately upon such Termination of Employment, such Participant may, upon notice in a manner suitable to the Plan Administrator, withdraw aggregate distributions up to $100,000 from September 23, until December 31, 2006 of employee contributions and vested firm contributions pursuant to the Gulf Opportunity Zone Act of 2005 that allows distributions to an individual who has sustained an economic loss from Hurricane Rita and whose principal place of abode on September 23, 2005 was in the Hurricane Rita disaster area.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>In the event a Participant shall incur a Termination of Employment under circumstances such that the Participant is not entitled to receive payment of his benefits under the Plan immediately upon such Termination of Employment, such Participant may, upon notice in a manner suitable to the Plan Administrator, withdraw aggregate distributions up to $100,000 from October 23, until December 31, 2006 of employee contributions and vested firm contributions pursuant to the Gulf Opportunity Zone Act of 2005 that allows distributions to an individual who has sustained an economic loss from Hurricane Wilma and whose principal place of abode on October 23, 2005 was in the Hurricane Wilma disaster area.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>- 58 -</FONT></FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned as Secretary of A.G. Edwards, Inc. hereby certifies that this First Amendment was duly adopted by A.G. Edwards, Inc.</FONT></FONT></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>
<TR vAlign=bottom>

<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 1pt solid" noWrap align=left width="1%"><FONT size=2>/s/ Douglas L. Kelly</FONT></TD>
<TD align=left width="45%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TD align=left width="45%">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR vAlign=bottom>

<TD align=left width="3%"><FONT size=+0><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>

<TR vAlign=bottom>
<TD align=left width="50%"><FONT size=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD noWrap align=left width="3%"><FONT size=+0><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>Title:&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></FONT></TD>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>- 59 -</FONT></FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P align=center><B><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>SECOND AMENDMENT <BR>A.G. EDWARDS, INC.<BR></FONT></FONT></B><FONT size=2><B><FONT face=serif>EXCESS PROFIT SHARING<BR>DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN<BR></FONT></B></FONT><B><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>2002 RESTATEMENT</FONT></FONT></B></P>

<P align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>The A.G. Edwards, Inc. Excess Profit Sharing Deferred Compensation Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) was originally effective beginning with the 1983 calendar year. The Plan has been amended from time to time, most recently in the form of a restated plan document dated August 22, 2002 (the &#147;2002 Restatement&#148;) and a First Amendment to such Restatement.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A.G. Edwards, Inc. now wishes to amend the Plan.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW THEREFORE, the Plan is hereby amended as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1. The first paragraph of existing Paragraph 6 is restated as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B><I><FONT face=serif>Plan Year Account Return Options &#150; Post 1986.</FONT></I></B> <FONT face=serif>On and after June 1, 2000, participants may base the return of a post-1986 Plan Year Account on the performance of one or a combination of securities (the &#147;Funds&#148;) designated from time to time by the Investment Committee. Participants will have no ownership interest in the Funds, but their Plan Year Account balance shall increase or decrease based on the performance of the designated Fund(s). The Funds&#146; performance will be determined by industry acceptable performance measurement standards as determined by the Investment Committee. Effective December 26, 2001, the broker call rate is eliminated as a basis for determining the return for any unvested Plan Year Account.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>The Investment Committee in its sole discretion may from time to time add or delete Funds or other return options from the list of Funds or other return options which participants may base the return for a Plan Year Account.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2. The following paragraph is added as the second to last paragraph of existing Paragraph 9:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif><I>Vesting After Age 65.</I> The full amount credited to the B Account of the participant shall become fully vested on December 31 of the year in which the participant attains sixty-five (65) years of age and all subsequent amounts credited to the B Account of the participant shall vest on December 31 of the year awarded in which the amount is credited to the B Account.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3. The last paragraph of Paragraph 9 is restated as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>- 60 -</FONT></FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Accelerated Vesting at Normal Retirement.</I> Upon the Termination of Employment of the participant on or after the participant attains age sixty-five (65) years of age, the unvested balance of the B Account of the participant shall become fully vested upon the first anniversary of such Termination of Employment regardless of the number of years of service of the participant at such time. In the event a participant who so retires subsequently engages in competition, as defined in Paragraph 23 of this Plan, the B Account balance of the participant that is not fully vested at the time the participant first so engages in competition shall be forfeited, unless the participant is rehired by the Company on or before the first anniversary of his or her retirement date. The balance credited to the B Account of a participant that becomes fully vested after the participant so retires shall
(so long as the participant is not rehired) be paid as such time or times provided below as if the participant had incurred a Termination of Employment on the day the B Account becomes fully vested.</FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>4. Change the heading of existing Paragraph 11 to read: <B><I>Payment of A Accounts -- Pre-1999 Plan Years.</I></B></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>5. Add Paragraph 12 as follows and renumber remaining Paragraphs as applicable:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif></FONT><B><I><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>Payment of A Accounts &#150; Post 1998 Plan Years.</FONT></FONT></I></B></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Normal Time of Payment.</I> Benefits payable under this Plan attributable to a Plan Year A Account shall become payable upon vesting and paid as soon as administratively practical after such time; provided that Benefits for a Plan year of a participant who incurs a Termination of Employment after attaining sixty-five (65) years of age shall become payable one (1) year after the Termination of Employment. Subject to the deferral election provisions below, such benefits shall be paid to the participant in one-lump sum payment as soon as practical after such time.</FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon Termination of Employment of a participant after the participant attains age fifty-five (55); or after the combination of full years of age plus full years of service of the participant exceeds 70, but before the participant attains sixty-five (65) years of age (&#147;early retirement&#148;), the balance credited to a Plan Year A Account of the participant that becomes fully vested after the participant takes early retirement shall (so long as the participant is not rehired) become payable upon vesting and paid as soon as administratively practical after such time.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>General Deferral Election.</I> A participant may elect to defer payment of a Plan Year A Account balance in a lump sum payment for a period of at least five (5) years from the normal time of payment. Such an election shall be made no later than twelve (12) months before the normal time of payment. A participant</FONT></P>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>- 61 -</FONT></FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>may again elect a further deferred payment date that is at least five years later than the previously scheduled payment date. Such a subsequent election also shall be made no later than twelve (12) months before the previously scheduled payment date.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I>Election Procedures.</I> An election to defer a benefit pursuant to this Paragraph must be delivered to the Plan Administrator at such time and in such form and manner as is acceptable to the Plan Administrator. An election shall be irrevocable after the deadline for making such election. A participant may elect a payment with respect to each Plan Year A Account independently of any other Plan Year A Account.</FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A payment scheduled to be made after the end of a Plan Year shall be made as soon as administratively practicable after the end of the year.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any of the payment provisions noted in this Paragraph, a participant will receive payment of all vested monies the earlier of 1) 5 years following termination of employment; or 2) his or her scheduled fixed payment date.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>6. Existing Paragraph 12 is restated as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 25pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>13.<FONT face=sans-serif></FONT> <B><I>Payment of B Accounts.</I></B></FONT></FONT><B><I><FONT face=serif></FONT></I></B></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><FONT face=serif>Normal Time of Payment.</FONT></I> <FONT face=serif>The vested portion of the B Account shall become payable on the date such portion becomes vested in accordance with Paragraph 9 or 10, whichever is applicable, and shall be paid in a lump sum payment as soon as administratively practicable after such time.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><FONT face=serif>Age 65 Deferral Election.</FONT></I> <FONT face=serif>Provided the participant is employed by the Company, the participant may elect to defer payment of his or her B Account balance in a lump sum payment for a period of at least five (5) years from the normal time of payment. Such an election shall be made no later than twelve (12) months prior to the normal time of payment.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<I><FONT face=serif>Election Procedures.</FONT></I> <FONT face=serif>An election to defer pursuant to this Paragraph must be delivered to the Plan Administrator at such time and in such form and manner as is acceptable to the Plan Administrator. An election shall be irrevocable after the deadline for making such election.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>Notwithstanding any of the payment provisions noted in this Paragraph, a participant will receive payment of all vested monies the earlier of 1) 5 years following termination of employment; or 2) his or her scheduled fixed payment date.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>- 62 -</FONT></FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>7. The first paragraph of existing Paragraph 14 is restated as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B><I><FONT face=serif>Payment Upon Death.</FONT></I></B> <FONT face=serif>In the event of the death of a participant, the entire balance credited to all Accounts of the participant at the time of the death of the participant shall be paid to the beneficiary in a single lump sum as soon as administratively practical after the death of the participant as determined by the Plan Administrator in its sole discretion.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>8. The following is added as the second paragraph to existing Paragraph 16:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>The Plan Administrator may adopt policies and procedures necessary or advisable to implement the Treasury Department&#146;s temporary regulations relating to the American Jobs Creation Act of 2004 (the &#147;2004 Act&#148;). The Executive Committee of A.G. Edwards, Inc. may approve any Plan amendments necessary or advisable to implement such temporary regulations of the 2004 Act.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>9. Add Paragraph 19 as follows:</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<B><I><FONT face=serif>Investment Committee.</FONT></I></B> <FONT face=serif>The Plan Administrator shall appoint an Investment Committee to serve at its pleasure. The members of the Investment Committee may be a corporation (including the Sponsor), one or more individuals or any combination of the above. The Plan Administrator may change such appointments from time to time provided that such changes are published to the extent of enabling interested parties to ascertain the person or persons responsible for operating the Plan.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>In the absence of such an appointment, the Compensation Committee of A.G. Edwards &amp; Sons, Inc. shall serve as the Investment Committee.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>Any member serving on the Investment Committee may, but need not, be an employee, and may, but need not, be a participant. Any member shall serve, in the case of natural persons until his death, resignation or removal and in the case of a corporation until its liquidation, resignation or removal. The Compensation Committee of A.G. Edwards &amp; Sons, Inc. in its sole discretion, may remove any member of the Investment Committee at any time. A member serving on the Investment Committee may resign by delivering a written resignation to the Compensation Committee of A.G. Edwards &amp; Sons, Inc.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>All resolutions and other actions of the Investment Committee may be adopted and effected by a majority of a quorum of the Investment Committee at the time of such action. A quorum of the Investment Committee shall be comprised of no fewer than fifty percent (50%) of the members then serving. An</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P align=center><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>- 63 -</FONT></FONT></P>

<HR align=center width="100%" noShade SIZE=2>


<PAGE>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>action of the Investment Committee also shall be valid if concurred in by unanimous written consent in lieu of a meeting. A member may participant in a meeting by means of a conference telephone or similar communications equipment.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P style="PADDING-RIGHT: 15pt; PADDING-LEFT: 15pt" align=justify><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif>The Investment Committee may appoint one or more of its members to carry out any particular duty or duties or to execute any and all documents. Any documents so executed shall have the same effect as if executed by all such persons. Such appointment shall be made by an instrument in writing that specifies which duties and powers are so allocated and to whom each such duty or power is so allocated.</FONT></FONT><FONT face=serif></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif><FONT size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned as Secretary of A.G. Edwards, Inc. hereby certifies that this Second Amendment was duly adopted by A.G. Edwards, Inc.</FONT></FONT></P>

<P align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>We consent to the incorporation by reference in Registration Statements Nos. 333-127719; 333-127718; 333-126234; 333-98669, 333-87507, 33-61949, 33-52786, 33-36609, and 33-23837 of A.G. Edwards, Inc. on Form S-8 of our reports dated May 2, 2006, relating to the consolidated financial statements and financial statement schedule of A.G. Edwards, Inc. and subsidiaries (which report expresses an unqualified opinion and includes an explanatory paragraph related to the adoption of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123 (revised 2004), &#147;Share-Based Payment&#148;) and management&#146;s report on the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, appearing in this Annual Report on Form 10-K of A.G. Edwards, Inc. for the year ended February 28, 2006.</FONT></P>

<TYPE>EX-32.I

<FILENAME>exhibit32-i.htm
<DESCRIPTION>SECTION 1350 CERTIFICATIONS
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>
   <TITLE>edwards_10k4.pdf -- Converted by SECPublisher 4.0, created by BCL Technologies Inc., for SEC Filing</TITLE>
</HEAD>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">

<P align=right><B><FONT face=serif size=2>EXHIBIT 32(i)</FONT></B></P>
<P align=center><B><FONT face=serif size=2>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT<BR>TO 18
U.S.C. SECTION 1350,<BR>AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR></FONT></B><B><FONT face=serif size=2>SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002*</FONT></B></P>
<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif size=2>In
connection with the Annual Report of A.G. Edwards, Inc. (the &#147;Registrant&#148;) on
Form 10-K for the period ended February 28, 2006, as filed with the Securities
and Exchange Commission on May 5, 2006, hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), I, Robert L.
Bagby, Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of the Registrant,
certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to section 906
of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:</FONT></P>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>

  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap  >&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=serif size=2>(1)</FONT>&nbsp; &nbsp;
      &nbsp; </TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=serif size=2>The Report fully complies with
      the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act
      of 1934, and</FONT> </TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD noWrap  ></TD>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap  ></TD>
    <TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=serif size=2>(2)</FONT>&nbsp; &nbsp;
      &nbsp; </TD>
    <TD width="100%"><FONT face=serif size=2>The information contained in the
      Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition
      and results of operations of the Registrant.</FONT> </TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD noWrap  ></TD>
    <TD width="100%" colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 width="100%" border=0>

  <TR vAlign=bottom>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="50%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD noWrap align=left width="49%" colSpan=2><FONT face=serif size=2>A.G.
      EDWARDS, INC.</FONT>&nbsp; </TD></TR>
  <TR>
    <TD width="99%" colSpan=3>&nbsp; </TD></TR>
  <TR vAlign=bottom>

<BODY bgColor=#ffffff><P align=right><B><FONT face=serif size=2>EXHIBIT 32(ii)</FONT></B></P>

<P align=center><B><FONT face=serif size=2>CERTIFICATION PURSUANT<BR>TO 18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350, <BR>AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO<BR></FONT></B><B><FONT face=serif size=2>SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002*</FONT></B></P>

<P align=justify>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<FONT face=serif size=2>In connection with the Annual Report of A.G. Edwards, Inc. (the &#147;Registrant&#148;) on Form 10-K for the period ended February 28, 2006, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on May 5, 2006, hereof (the &#147;Report&#148;), I, Douglas L. Kelly, Chief Financial Officer of the Registrant, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350, as adopted pursuant to section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:</FONT></P>

<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=serif size=2>(1)</FONT>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
<TD width="100%">
<P align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, and</FONT> </P>
</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD noWrap></TD>
<TD width="100%" colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap></TD>
<TD vAlign=top noWrap><FONT face=serif size=2>(2)</FONT>&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; </TD>
<TD width="100%">
<P align=justify><FONT face=serif size=2>The information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Registrant.</FONT> </P>
</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD noWrap></TD>
<TD width="100%" colSpan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
